climbs.name: Short Lived
climbs.fa: Bryan Beavers, Paul Tusting, Clay Calhoun 7/10/02

content.description: Follow the crack to the top.
content.protection: One bolt down low, single rack, two bolt anchors shared with Flesh Wound and Baby Thor
content.location: About 100 feet right of Humble Pie, middle route

content.description: Climb up under a roof, pull the roof on not so good pinches, then move toward the bottom of what looked to be a nice hand crack, then go up the crack to the top. A lot of horizontal cracks to use as well. All the cracks are dirty, but protection can still be placed. It looked like it was going to be an awesome crack, wasn't that awesome once I got up there. Maybe it will get better after some traffic?
content.protection:
Single rack, nuts, hexes, nothing special. No anchors on top, build your own.

Can walk off the top either way, or down climb the 4th class gully about 30 feet to the west.
content.location: About 30 feet right of Humble Pie, look for what looks like a great crack going up from a small roof.

climbs.name: Humble Pie
climbs.fa: Paul Tusting, Clay Calhoun (Solo), Bryan Beavers (Solo) 7/13/02

content.description:
A steep face climb, starting with thin crimps to a big horizontal crack, this is where you find the crux, moving from there up through some thin and fun moves (I used a heel hook at one point) until your feet are in the next big horizontal crack. From there just fun face climbing to the anchors.

There is a very hollow flake like section about 3/4 way up, but it feels solid and has been there for years.
content.protection: Gear to anchors, looked like a normal rack would work, I top roped this one so not sure. Anchors are 2 rappel rings, shared with Dirty Secrets
content.location: In a small alcove about 30 feet right of briefcase.

content.description:
Flying Butter ascends the shallow left facing corner past a few horizontal cracks to a nice ledge. Harder moves right off the ground, then gets easier. Bolted anchor is tucked away in the back of ledge.

Great route for new trad leaders or done as a top rope. Mostly small to medium gear.
content.protection: mostly small to medium cams and nuts. Bolted anchor.
content.location: Located about 10 feet left of Butterfly arete (only bolted route).

content.description: Climb a shallow crack just left of Short Lived
content.protection: One bolt at the bottom, single rack, shares bolt anchors with Short Lived
content.location: Right side of crag, about 100 feet right of Humble Pie

content.description:
Really fun route, watch for rope drag, as you move to the right quite a bit.

Start left of the arete, as you move up, move right to the arete. Then up through a little bit of a corner, then a really short traverse to the anchors.
content.protection: Gear to rappel rings. Nuts, hexes, or cams from 0.3 up to a 2, whatever you prefer to use, lots of options. Anchors are shared with Humble Pie
content.location: About 20 to 30 feet right of Brief Case, route starts right before the arete and small alcove where Humble Pie is located.

content.description: Use smears and underclings up to a finger crack in a corner. Follow the crack up, mantle up onto the ledge, then hop up the blocks to the anchors. Really no face holds in the crack section, good finger jams is a must.
content.protection: Finger size stuff, used mostly nuts, think I put a 0.5 C4 in there somewhere. Two rap rings on top for anchors
content.location: Around the left corner of Brief Case

content.description:
Butterfly Arete is the only sport route on this wall. It's very well protected with 4 bolts and it has it's own bolted anchor. It climbs a steep and technical arete and has several fun dynamic moves on positive horizontal holds.

Can easily be top roped by accessing from top.
content.location: Located 10 feet right of Flying Butter, and just left of Baby Thor.

content.description: Start by pulling a roof, go up a few moves, pull another roof, and you are at the anchors.
content.protection: Gear to the two anchor bolts
content.location: Left side of the crag, look for the 2 black bolts above a big roof.

climbs.name: Baby Thor
climbs.fa: Bryan Beavers, Paul Tusting, Clay Calhoun 7/10/02

content.description: Climb right facing corner until a bolt on the left, clip it, then move under it and up to the anchors
content.protection: One bolt, single rack, 2 bolt anchors shared with Flesh Wound and Short Lived
